bibl.title: The Role of the Syngraphe "Compiled through the Hierothytai". A Reconsideration of W. Schubart's Theory in Light of a Recently Published Alexandrian Marriage Contract (P. Berol. 25423).
bibl.note: P. Berol. Inv. 25423 [ed.: William BRASHEAR, An Alexandrian Marriage Contract, Classical Studies in Honor of David Sohlberg (Ramat Gan, 1996) pp. 367-384 et 2 pll.]. "The syngraphe was used as a written instrument to establish hereditary settlements, in case these diverged from the hereditary custom. It was not a testament, but served on occasions the same purpose."
YIFTACH Uri, The Role of the Syngraphe "Compiled through the Hierothytai". A Reconsideration of W. Schubart's Theory in Light of a Recently Published Alexandrian Marriage Contract (P. Berol. 25423).
